text: Hi <@UL13V8Y9W>, create a choice field and populate it with some values for example span1, span2 etc. Then check in the hubl code if choice.value == 'span1' display an 1 column div OR even better create a dynamic module where you add the choice.value into the div. Something like this: ``` <div class="{{ choice.value }}"> </div> ```

Thanks Robert! I'll try this out. What I'm trying to accomplish is to have a Customers table in HubDB where I have one customer per row. Then, the designer would manually create a page for a specific customer and select the customer from a drop-down so  that part of that page gets populated with content from the table. I understand there's also the possibility to create dynamic pages automatically from a table, but I fear that those pages are not customizable (the different customer pages would have varying content, different success stories to download and so forth)
Is there a way to build a "sidebar" with blocks that are customizable to individual blog posts?
have an example of what you mean?

Check this out: <https://blog.memphischamber.com/> I would like to be able to make those orange and blue blocks editable on a post by post basis. So that the content is specific to a single post. So that I could have ad blocks for specific content.
ah yeah.  totally.  just create your modules and then call them in your blog-post template
But I would have to make a custom module for each post that way, correct? I can't have a single module that can be customized per post, right?
it would be a custom module that would appear on each post and you would be able to edit it per post
you could wrap it in an if statement so if there is no content inside the module, it wouldnt appear on the post
That would be perfect. Do modules just behave that way out of the box or is it called a certain type of module?
that is the standard module behavior.  you can also make global modules that are the same globally
Ahhhh, thank you! I really appreciate the help.
